title: Blue Origin, SpaceX, ULA Selected for National Security Missions
summary: In an announcement on June 13th, SpaceX, United Launch Alliance, and Blue Origin were selected for the Department of Defense’s National Security Space Launch (NSSL) Phase 3 program. All three providers are now eligible to compete for a series of 30+ launches, with a combined value of $5.6 billion, expected from 2025 to 2029.

title: Senate Armed Services Committee advances 2025 defense policy bill
summary: The SASC bill requires the U.S. Air Force to transfer certain space functions of the Air National Guard to the U.S. Space Force
